note.p: Unitarian minister. Son of a labourer; became a qualified schoolmaster at the age of 22. Master, Flowery Field School, Hyde, 1841. Attended Manchester New College; assistant minister, 1845; minister, 1846. Wrote on education, science, theology, and philosophy. Theological tutor, Unitarian Home Missionary Board, 1874–8.
Census returns of England and Wales 1871 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG10/3969/10/13)
